p: Condensed tannins in hempseed by-products have the potential for suppressing gastrointestinal tract (GIT) nematodes ( 123, 124, 126) by inhibiting development of helminth eggs, reducing larvae, and adult motility as well as increasing the host animal's nutrient supply ( 123, 126). In that regard, hempseed by-products have the potential of improving gut health and preventing nutritional disorders among ruminants.
